title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryClientSide - Q0001
text: What is the main purpose of client-side service discovery in microservices?

options.text: To allow clients to locate service instances directly

explanation: Client-side discovery allows clients to locate and connect directly to available service instances using a service registry.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryClientSide - Q0002
text: Which component is essential for client-side service discovery?
explanation: A service registry is essential for client-side discovery, as it stores the network locations of service instances.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryClientSide - Q0003
text: In client-side discovery, who is responsible for load balancing?
explanation: In client-side discovery, the client performs load balancing by selecting a service instance from the registry.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryClientSide - Q0004
text: Which of the following best describes the workflow of client-side discovery?

options.text: Client queries registry → selects instance → sends request
Client sends request → registry forwards to instance

explanation: In client-side discovery, the client queries the registry, selects an instance, and sends the request directly.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryClientSide - Q0005
text: Which of the following is a common service registry used in client-side discovery?
explanation: Netflix Eureka is a popular service registry used for client-side service discovery.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryClientSide - Q0006
text: Which of the following is a key advantage of client-side discovery?
explanation: Client-side discovery reduces dependency on intermediaries by allowing clients to handle routing directly.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryClientSide - Q0007
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of client-side discovery?
explanation: A disadvantage of client-side discovery is that clients must implement discovery and load-balancing logic.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryClientSide - Q0008
text: Which of the following best describes the role of the service registry?

options.text: Maintains a list of available service instances

explanation: The service registry maintains a list of available service instances and their network locations.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryClientSide - Q0009
text: Which of the following is a common client library for client-side discovery?
explanation: Netflix Ribbon is a client library that provides client-side load balancing and service discovery.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryClientSide - Q0010
text: In client-side discovery, how does the client know which service instances are available?

options.text: By reading from a configuration file

explanation: The client queries the service registry to obtain a list of available service instances.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryClientSide - Q0011
text: Which of the following is a key responsibility of the client in client-side discovery?

options.text: Selecting a service instance for each request

explanation: The client is responsible for selecting a service instance from the registry for each request.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryClientSide - Q0012
text: Which of the following is a benefit of client-side discovery for scalability?

options.text: Clients distribute load directly across instances
All requests go through a central proxy
Clients depend on a single load balancer

explanation: Client-side discovery allows clients to distribute load directly across service instances, improving scalability.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryClientSide - Q0013
text: Which of the following is a challenge of client-side discovery?

options.text: Clients must handle service discovery logic

explanation: A challenge of client-side discovery is that clients must implement discovery and load-balancing logic.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryClientSide - Q0014
text: Which of the following is a benefit of client-side discovery for fault tolerance?

options.text: All requests go through a single proxy
Clients depend on a central router

explanation: Clients can detect and avoid failed instances, improving fault tolerance.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryClientSide - Q0015
text: Which of the following is a benefit of client-side discovery for performance?
explanation: Client-side discovery eliminates extra network hops by allowing direct communication between client and service.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryClientSide - Q0016
text: Which of the following is a common drawback of client-side discovery?
explanation: Client-side discovery increases client complexity because clients must handle discovery and load balancing.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryClientSide - Q0017
text: Which of the following is a typical registry update mechanism?
explanation: Service instances send heartbeats or health checks to keep their registration active in the registry.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryClientSide - Q0018

options.text: Clients can make independent routing decisions

explanation: Client-side discovery gives clients autonomy to make independent routing decisions based on registry data.

options.text: Clients directly discover and connect to service instances

explanation: Client-side discovery enables clients to directly discover and connect to service instances using a registry.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryClientSide - Q0022
